lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* This class parses and stores a command from the user.
* Public Constructor for Command that processes the input
* @param input the input typed by the user
* A deadline is a Task that recognises /by deadline
public Deadline(String description) throws EmptyDescriptionException, WrongFormatException {

* Duke(Hiko created by me) is a personal assistant.
public static final List<Task> TASKS = new ArrayList<>();
hikoPrint("Hello from\n" + logo + "What can I do for you?\n");
private static void handleDelete(String arg) throws WrongFormatException, ListIndexException {
"\nNow you have " + TASKS.size() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new WrongFormatException("delete <index for the task>");
private static void handleMarkDone(String arg) throws WrongFormatException, ListIndexException {
hikoPrint("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + task + "\n");
throw new WrongFormatException("done <index for the task>");
String msg = "Got it. I've added this task:\n  " +
"\nNow you have " + TASKS.size() + " tasks in the list.\n";
output = "Hey! You have not added any task...\n";
output = "Here are the tasks in your list:\n";
System.out.println(ANSI_PURPLE + "Bye! Hope to see you again soon!" + ANSI_RESET);
* This is the parent for all Exceptions that can be thrown
* This is thrown when an Action in the command is not recognised.
super("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(\n");
* This is thrown when the Description of the task is empty.
super("The description of a task cannot be empty.\n");
* This is thrown to help the user with the command format.

super("Please use the correct format:
  " + format + "
So that I can understand!
");
* This is thrown when the index is out of bound to give a more useful message.
super("Please enter the number within the range of the list!\n");
* An Event is a Task that recognises /at time
public Event(String description) throws EmptyDescriptionException, WrongFormatException {
private static String processEventDescription(String description) throws WrongFormatException {
* A representation of task with description and status
* @param description the description for the task.
* return the string representation of the task status.

return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
